METS_Profile.title: Royal Danish Library METS profile for digital cultural heritage version 2
METS_Profile.abstract: The METS profile for the Royal Danish Library specifies how METS documents representing digital objects in the digital archives for the Royal Danish Library should be encoded. The digital objects includes different types of images, audio, video, text and other various file formats. All MUST, MUST NOT, SHOULD, SHOULD NOT and MAY terms are used according to the meaning defined in RFC 2119 (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2119.txt).

description_rules.head: Purpose of this profile
description_rules.xhtml:p: The main purpose of this profile is to describe the requirements for encoding metadata in METS documents used by the Royal Danish Library.
description_rules.head: Rules for the XML
description_rules.xhtml:p: Every METS XML document conforming to this profile must have a XML-header with a clearly defined version and encoding, e.g. a METS document of XML version 1.0 and encoded with the UTF-8 encoded Unicode and must therefore begin with the standard XML declaration: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>. Also, the METS document must only contain valid XML.
description_rules.head: Definition of different metadata types
description_rules.xhtml:p: It is important to distinguish between different types of objects the METS contains metadata for. This concerns distinction between the METS containing metadata for a single digital object, or whether the METS document contains the metadata for representing a logical object. This will be refered to as a METS with TYPE attribute of the root <mets> element set to either 'FILE' or 'REPRESENTATION' respectively.

The METS for a single digital object will only concern with the metadata specific for the given digital object. It will not concern the relationship between the digital object and other digital or logical objects. E.g. the METS for a TIFF image of a page in a book will not contain metadata refering to other pages in the book, nor will it contain references to a logical object representing the book. It will only contain the metadata specific to the given image, especially the technical metadata.

The METS for representing a logical object will both contain the metadata specific for the logical object and the relationship between the different objects (logical or digital), which the logical representation consists of.

The METS may contain both a logical object and one of the metadata for one of the digital objects it consists of. In this case digital object must be clearly referenced in the <fileSec>, and its order must be clearly defined in the <structMap>.
description_rules.head: METS metadata identifier
description_rules.xhtml:p: A METS document conforming to this profile must be assigned a persistent and globally unique identifier, which must be locally resolvable. This means that a local system must be able to retrieve the METS document by using only the given identifier. The identifier must follow standardized identifier schemes.

This unique identifier must be the primary identifier for the METS document, and it must therefore be recorded in the OBJID attribute of the root <mets> element. Any digital object refering to the METS document must do so by using the identifier.
The identifier for the METS document must not be identical to an identifier of any digital object, which are referenced by the METS document, or whose metadata are documented by the METS document.
description_rules.head: Intellectual Entity Identifer
description_rules.xhtml:p:
If the METS document contains the metadata for an instance of some intellectual entity, then it must embed technical metadata in the PREMIS:OBJECT format which contains a <premis:relationship> element with <premis:relationshipType>'structural'</premis:relationshipType> and <premis:relationshipSubType>'represents'</premis:relationshipSubType> where the identifier for the intellectual entity is placed in the <premis:relatedObjectIdentifier> element. This intellectual entity identifier must be a persistent identifier, which is globally unique for the given intellectual entity. Though it is possible to have more than one instance of an intellectual entity, the given intellectual entity must be uniquely identified through the intellectual entity identifier. E.g. the intellectual entity of a text may be represented by text document, a pdf-document, an image of the text document, etc. All of these representations of the intellectual entity must have the same intellectual entity identifier.
The intellectual entity identifier must be locally resolvable for locating all the METS documents regarding the intellectual entity.
description_rules.head: Definition of agents
description_rules.xhtml:p: In both METS and PREMIS agents are used for various purposes such as reference to institutions, departments, applications, individuals, etc. These agents are used for determining the different roles regarding the METS document and the digital objects represented by the METS document. The roles involves the creator, the owner, the events described in embedded PREMIS:EVENT elements, etc.

All the agents involved with METS documents conforming to this profile should be defined at "http://id.kb.dk/authorities/agents". Here a thorough description will be presented in accordance to the PREMIS:AGENT specification, which may embed other metadata formats, e.g. MODS.

The agents will be identified with a locally unique identifier, which is resolvable at "http://id.kb.dk", and the respective description of the agents must be persistent. Since the agents can be changed or updated in a way where the description also requires changes/updates, then a new version of the agent must registrered at "http://id.kb.dk/" with a new identifier. Therefore the identifier of an agent should contain a version to reflect which version of the agent is referred to.

All the agents used in the METS document are defined in the <metsHdr> element, where each <agent> must contain the ID attribute with the identifier for the agent. The value of the ID attribute must then be resolvable at "http://id.kb.dk". Such an <agent> must also contain the TYPE attribute to describe the relation to the METS document. The TYPE must be either "individual", "organization", or "application".

The agents in PREMIS are used for the preservation data, especially regarding the PREMIS:EVENT. The agents used in PREMIS should be defined at "http://id.kb.dk", and these must be referred from a <premis:linkingAgentIdentifier> element, where the <premis:linkingAgentIdentifierType> must be one of the predefined identifier types: "kbDkInternal", "kbDkPersonal" or "kbDkDepartment". The value of <premis:linkingAgentIdentifierValue> must then be the agent identifier, which is resolvable at "http://id.kb.dk".
description_rules.head: Definition of Preservation Levels
description_rules.xhtml:p: The level of preservation is described in the preservation part of the PREMIS metadata embedded in the METS. All the METS documents conforming to this profile must have this embedded PREMIS document containing the <premis:preservationLevel> defined from the elements <premis:preservationLevelType>, <premis:preservationLevelValue>, and <premis:preservationLevelDateAssigned>. The <premis:preservationLevel> may also include a <premis:preservationLevelRationale> and a <premis:preservationLevelRole> to elaborate the reasons for the values in the other fields.

The term preservation can be interpreted in different way, e.g. bit safety, logical strategy, and confidentiality. It must be possible to assign different values for the different kinds of preservation, and therefore it must possible to assign several <premis:preservationLevel> elements to a digital object. Each of these must use the <premis:preservationLevelType> for distinguishing which type of preservation the <premis:preservationLevelValue> is referring to.
The preservationLevelValue will be thoroughly defined at "http://id.kb.dk/vocabulary/preservationLevelValue.html".
description_rules.head: Definition of Event types
description_rules.xhtml:p: All the events regarding the digital object should be recorded. The different event types are defined at "http://id.kb.dk/vocabulary/preservationEvents.html".
description_rules.head: References
description_rules.xhtml:p: All references to internal elements within the METS document must be in the format of 'xs:ID' and 'xs:IDREFS'. The identifiers for all the embedded metadata must each be assigned an ID, and the <mets:structMap> must contain a <div> element which have a IDREF attribute reference to the given embedded metadata. E.g. a METS document with an embedded MODS element with ID="mods1" within the <dmdSec> should also contain a <div> with the attribute DMDID="mods1".
References to external digital objects to the METS document must have a unique identifier, preferably in the format of an UUID with the type 'URN' and the reference value prefixed by 'urn:uuid:'.

References to the digital object may also occur within the embedded metadata formats, like the <mods:identifier> of the MODS metadata or the <premis:objectIdentifier> of the PREMIS:OBJECT, where such references are required for the embedded metadata documents to validate their respective schemas.

In case of inconsistency between these references, it must be the first reference reached, which is the valid one. The METS XML document is read as an XML tree, starting from the <structMap>. The first reference should therefore be found in the <fileSec>.

ORGANIZATION

vocabulary.context: Defined as an extension to the METS attribute TYPE for the <mets:agent> elements in the <mets:metsHdr> element. If the value does not comply to the restriction of the TYPE attribute according to the METS schema, then the TYPE attribute must be set to OTHER and the value must be placed in the attribute OTHERTYPE.

vocabulary.name: PREMIS Suggested Event Types

values.value: CAPTURE = the process whereby a repository actively obtains an object
COMPRESSION = the process of coding data to save storage space or transmission time
DEACCESSION = the process of removing an object from the inventory of a repository
DECOMPRESSION = the process of reversing the effects of compression
DECRYPTION = the process of converting encrypted data to plain text
DELETION = the process of removing an object from repository storage
DIGITAL_SIGNATURE_VALIDATION = the process of determining that a decrypted digital signature matches an expected value
DISSEMINATION = the process of retrieving an object from repository storage and making it available to users
FIXITY_CHECK = the process of verifying that an object has not been changed in a given period
INGESTION = the process of adding objects to a preservation repository
MESSAGE_DIGEST CALCULATION = the process by which a message digest ("hash") is created
MIGRATION = a transformation of an object creating a version in a more contemporary format
NORMALIZATION = a transformation of an object creating a version more conducive to preservation
REPLICATION = the process of creating a copy of an object that is, bit-wise, identical to the original
VALIDATION = the process of comparing an object with a standard and noting compliance or exceptions
VIRUS_CHECK = the process of scanning a file for malicious programs

vocabulary.context: PREMIS Suggested Event Types are used as values for the eventType element which is used for the METS digiprovMD sections.

description.xhtml:p: The root <mets> element must include an OBJID attribute. The value of this attribute must be the primary, persistent, and unique identifier for the METS document. This must not be identical to the identifier of any object referred to by the METS document, e.g. in the fileSec or structMap.

The root <mets> element must include a TYPE attribute value. This must reflect whether the METS file is metadata for a single file or whether the metadata is for a representation consisting of several files. Therefore it must either have the value 'FILE' or 'REPRESENTATION'.
The root <mets> element must include an PROFILE attribute value containing a reference to this document, as given in the related section.

The <structMap> section and the <fileSec> section must be linked together through the FILEID attribute of a <fptr> element in the <structMap> and the ID attribute of a <file> element in the <fileSec>.

All embedded metadata in both the <dmdSec> and the subsections to the <amdSec> must have a local identifier, and this identifier must be refered to by the DMDID or AMDID attributes of a <div> element in the <structMap> element.

A FILE METS document containing MODS metadata embedded in the <dmdSec> must have the same UUID reference for the file both in the <mets:fptr> within the <structMap> and the <mods:identifier type="uri"> within the MODS (there might be other <mods:identifier> for the file, but one of them must have the same UUID reference).
It must be possible to encode the metadata of a content file with any file format into a METS conforming to this profile.
Royal Danish Library requires all dates to conform to the W3CDTF profile of ISO 8601, and all language codes must conform to the RFC 4646.
A FILE METS document conforming to this profile must reference the content file.

A REPRESENTATION METS document conforming to this profile must reference each of the digital objects which form the logical object represented by the REPRESENTATION METS. E.g. A REPRESENTATION METS document must contain references either to other REPRESENTATION METS documents, to FILE METS documents, or a combination of these two.
Any reference to a external digital object must be included as a UUID of type URN in the <FLocat> elements within the <fileSec>. This UUID must be locally resolvable.
There must not be any behaviors associated with a conforming document.

All metadata formats embedded into the METS document must be clearly defined through a schema, and any instance of such metadata format must conform to the given schema definition. All embedded metadata formats must be in XML.

description.xhtml:p: Any METS document conforming to this profile, along with any embedded metadata formats within the METS, will contain a XSD schema location refering to the XSD which can be used for validation.
